item.title: We're Losing Our Voice to LLMs | Tony Alicea
item.description: We are losing something precious in the age of LLMs: our unique voices.

item.title: Google's Antigravity IDE Sparks Forking Debate -- Visual Studio Magazine
item.description: Google's new Antigravity IDE spurred much developer debate focusing heavily on its apparent status as a Visual Studio Code fork, with developers debating why another fork is needed, what it means for the VS Code ecosystem, and how open source reuse, lock-in, and fragmentation should be handled in AI-focused development tools.

item.title: Linux Kernel Explorer | reverser.dev
item.description: Interactive Linux kernel source code browser with guided learning paths.

item.title: DIY NAS: 2026 Edition
item.description: An 8-bay DIY NAS with 10GbE networking, TrueNAS 25.10.1, an Intel N355 CPU, 32GB of DDR5 RAM, and a smallish form factor that occupies less than 20 liters of your office space.

item.title: Ilya Sutskever, Yann LeCun and the End of “Just Add GPUs” — abZ Global
item.description: When two of the most influential people in AI both say that today’s large language models are hitting their limits , it’s worth paying attention. In a recent long-form interview, Ilya Sutskever – co-founder of OpenAI and now head of Safe Superintelligence Inc. – argued that the industry is movin

item.title: DOOMed to Fail: A Horror Story - CoRecursive Podcast
item.description: Today Rebecca Burger Becky Heineman shares the tale of porting Doom to the 3DO console under extreme conditions. There is an engine to tweak, deadlines to hit, hardware acceleration to get working, and dramatic rock anthems to record.We also learn about how game piracy led her to game development and what it was like to do game development in the... […]
